title: Prysm beacon node error "could not find block in DB"
body:
### Describe the bug

After a DB error in beacon node I ran full initial sync again and after days of syncing at the end I got this error>
nov 01 11:28:34 ETH-Validator1 prysm.sh[3833]: time="2023-11-01 11:28:34" level=info msg="Starting API middleware" prefix=gateway
nov 01 11:28:34 ETH-Validator1 prysm.sh[3833]: time="2023-11-01 11:28:34" level=fatal msg="could not update forkchoice's justified checkpoint: could not update justified balances: could not get justified balances: could not get state summary: could not find block in DB" prefix=blockchain 

Geth is synced. Restarts did not help.

Is the only way to start the full sync from beginning? I do not want to see the same after few days of syncing... 

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

```text
Did not see this before.
```


### ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

I do not know. Just appeared at the end of full "initial syncing".
geth start>
geth --http --http.api eth,net,engine,admin --authrpc.jwtsecret /home/pepe/bin/prysm/jwt.hex

beacon start>
/home/pepe/bin/prysm/prysm.sh beacon-chain --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --jwt-secret=/home/pepe/bin/prysm/jwt.hex --suggested-fee-recipient=0xe41883915ea4Da10C7921D2eA17c2e3c1586Bb54

validator start>
/home/pepe/bin/prysm/prysm.sh validator --wallet-dir=/home/pepe/wallet --wallet-password-file=/home/pepe/pw/password.txt

### Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?

_No response_

perhaps something got corrupted on an unsafe shutdown
https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/checkpoint-sync can get you synced back up to continue quickly if you don't need the whole chain.
